content.description:
Diagonal/Low-angle crack going up and left on the SE Face of Bigfoot Mating Grotto. There are shorter cracks that intersect the route, start from the very bottom. The FA was done as an onsight free solo, which was a challenge with all the lichen and loose rock. After deeming it worthy, I dropped a rope, pulled the blocks and scrubbed up the rock. Actually very unique and fun moves throughout the climb. Worth a lap if you are looking for some trad practice.

At the top, either go left up a hand crack to a gear anchor or right over steep bulges to the awkward bolt anchor for Hairy Palms.
content.protection: Nuts and a single rack up to #3
content.location: NE face/corner of Bigfoot Mating Grotto

content.description:
The northwest tower of Bigfoot Mating Grotto holds this beautiful bolted overhanging arete.

Size 12 starts at the leftward steep bulge (10 feet left of the bulge start to Bigfoot's Back Door and "Size 11"). Stand on a block and reach up to clip the first bolt and step down off the block for the exciting direct start off of the triangle hold (V6+). The bouldery crux is harder than that of Snagger, but shorter with less commitment.

At the third bolt, Size 12 and Size 11 converge. Continue up past two more bolts on easy terrain and then up the sweet overhanging arete with two more bolts to the chains.

With an attentive belay and clipping from the solid stances, the route is exciting and plenty safe. Remember to find the solid clipping stances for the last two bolts.

Enjoy!!!
content.protection: 6 bolts, chains and lower off biners
content.location: Short and sweet overhang up to the NW pinnicle of Bigfoot Mating Grotto. Left of Bigfoot's Back Door.

content.description:
Directly under the chain anchor for Bigfoot's Back Door is a beautiful bolted overhanging arete. Size 11 works up to the arete with an easier start than Size 12.

Begin at the bulge start of Bigfoot's Back Door and continue straight up the face towards the leftward arete. The route converges with Size 12 at the second bolt (Third bolt for Size 12). Follow the face up to the sweet overhanging arete with two more bolts before the chains.

Very fun route.
content.protection: 6 bolts, chains and lower off biners
content.location: Same start as Bigfoot's Back Door, but straight up after the second bolt.

content.description: Fun hand/fist crack at the start, then romp up to the big boulder and work up the right side in the short chimney. Pull on to the top of boulder and climb the mellow slab to the top. Tree anchor, scramble down the backside of the formation. Will clean up with more traffic
content.protection: Standard rack to 4". Tie off a solid flake. Tree anchor.

content.description: Tense friction up a slippery slab leads to a steep boulder with a nice hand crack. Above this, continue on easy slab to the top of the rock.
content.protection: 7 bolts to 2 bolt anchors with chains.

content.description:
Named with Backdoor Man 5.10c at Luffenholtz in mind, Bigfoot's Back Door follows a short, but exciting arete on the NW side of Bigfoot Mating Grotto.

Find the first bolt above the giant boulder and climb straight up over the bulge. Walk right and climb up (5.3) to the ledge under the overhang. From the ledge, reach high and clip the third bolt. Then the fun begins, hug the arete with a series of heel hooks, using crimps on the left side, and hidden jugs on the right side. Clip the third bolt from the solid clipping stance. Now move up and left past three more slightly hidden bolts on the left side of the arete, straight towards the anchor. Long or medium draws are useful on some bolts.

Much of this route can be made easier by traversing left or right (such as into the crack after the third bolt or moving way right of the last bolt), those options take you away from your bolts, safe falls, the AND the fun! Give yourself the most excitement and follow the bolts directly. The falls are safe so give it a try!

Easiest to clean by just having someone follow

since the route traverses up to the tower at the end.
content.protection: 7 bolts, chains with lower off biners
content.location: Farthest right route on the rock.

content.description: Variation that climbs Bigfoot Shuffle and continues up a layback crack to meet up with the upper section of Hairy Palms. One of the few 5.9s at LOTL. Lots of 5.8 and lots of 5.10, not so many 5.9s. Crux is moving right to Bigfoot Shuffle Anchors. The layback takes some commitment. Skips the crux of Hairy Palms and lands you on the top of Bigfoot Mating Grotto
content.protection: Draws, some longer, lower off anchors

content.description: Leftmost route on Bigfoot Mating Grotto. Climb past a well protected bulge then up a slab with plentiful edges. Chain anchor under a steep headwall.
content.location: Leftmost route on Bigfoot Mating Grotto.
